title: What is the difference between a bass guitar and an acoustic guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: The both are totally different class of guitars, as the name suggest, A bass guitar is specifically designed to be played as bass clef instrument, so it is one octave lower than the normal 6 string guitar. So the notes on bass guitar is always one octave lower than it's counterpart 6 string guitar. Where as an acoustic guitar is a guitar that amplifies it's sound acoustically without any help from an electronic amplifier or anyothwr electronic component. Now an acoustic guitar can be either a bass guitar or a 6 string guitar. Similarly a bass guitar can be an acoustic bass or an electric bass guitar.

Bass and acoustic are two different variants of guitar, basically the acoustic has 6 strings or 12 strings and bass on the other hand have 4 or 6 strings, the tone pitch of both guitars are entirely different , where the acoustic has this soothing clean sound on the other hand bass has a chorus thump sound. even though there is an option for acoustic bass also but the sound of bass and acoustic bass are totally different from the 6 string acoustic guitar i.e clean and unplugged.
